alert.note: Alert for Faribault (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:23PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Faribault County through 800 PM CDT... At 723 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blue Earth, or 13 miles east of Fairmont, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Blue Earth and Elmore around 735 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Frost and Bricelyn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 113 and 137. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
